description:
Installs an email request integration.

Email request integration creates tickets in OpsRamp via email.

Convert image to Base64 and enter the code in file field as shown in the following sample request.

displayName.description: Name used to identify the integration.

ipAddress.description: ipAddress for the private cloud. To be only used for compute Integration.

credentialSet.description: Name of credentialSets. Only used for compute Integration.

file.description: Base64 code file of the logo.

category.description:
Category describes the behavior of custom integration. Applicable only for Custom Integration installation.
Example: If monitoring is selected as category, the integration will work as monitoring integration.

alertSource.title: alertSource
alertSource.description: Source of alert. Applicable only when installing category is Monitoring. Default Alert Source is taken as Custom.

direction.description:
Direction of the installation. Applicable only when installing category is Collaboration.
The default direction is taken as Inbound-Outbound.

dropAlerts.description: Configure to drop alerts from UnManaged resources.

role.description: Role of the user: Mandatory only when installing category is selected as Custom. Default user role is used depending on other installing categories.

uniqueId.description: Unique ID of the role. For information on unique ID of the role, see Search Roles API.

credentialSet.description: Credential set to be assigned to the discovery profile.

policy.title: policy
policy.description:
Set of functions formed together as a policy and attached with the discovery profile.
Rules to filter the resources to which the discovery profile is attached

filterType.description:
Filtered resource type.
- AWS example: AUTO_SCALING, CLOUDFRONT, DYNAMO_DB, ANY_DEVICE, ELASTICACHE, ELASTICMAPREDUCE, KINESIS, LAMBDA, LOAD_BALANCER, MACHINE_LEARNING, RDS, REDSHIFT.
- Azure example: EBS, WEBSITE, SQL_SERVER, SQL_DATABASE, RESOURCE_GROUP, REDIS_CACHE, DOCUMENT_DB.
- Google example: ANY_CLOUD_RESOURCE, ANY_DEVICE, EBS, GCE_CLUSTER, SQL_SERVER, SQL_DATABASE, GCE_TOPIC, GCE_SUBSCRIPTION, GCE_ROUTER, VPN.

key.description: Unique attribute name to filter the resource type. Example: Name, Region Name, Zone Name, Name, Subject, Description.

operator.description: Operating values to filter the resource type. Example: Contains, Not Contains, Equals, Not Equals, Starts with, Ends with, Regex, Is.

schedule.title: schedule
schedule.description: (Optional) Define the discovery time of resources:

patternType.description: Discovery schedule pattern type. Example: HOURLY, DAILY, WEEKLY, MONTHLY, MINUTES.

pattern.description: Pattern of the schedule. Example: If pattern type is WEEKLY, then pattern is MON, WED.

entityTypes.description: Type of supported service desk entities (INCIDENT,CHANGE,SERVICEREQUEST,PROBLEM) using WEBHOOK only.

baseNotifier.title: notifier
baseNotifier.description: The fields are required unless specific to an `authType`.

userName.description: Username: Mandatory when authType is OAUTH2 and grantType is PASSWORD/REFRESH_TOKEN.

password.description: Password: Mandatory when authType is OAUTH2 and grantType is PASSWORD/REFRESH_TOKEN.

apiKey.description: API Key: Mandatory if authType is OAUTH2.

apiSecret.description: API Secret: Mandatory if authType is OAUTH2.

accessTokenURL.description: Access Token URL: Mandatory if authType is OAUTH2.

tokenHeaders.description: (JWT only) Headers to request the token.

tokensPath.description: (JWT only) Token path in the response of the authentication REST call.

resourceAuthHeaders.description: (JWT only) Authorization header for resource calls.

identifier.description: Unique value of a set.Email data identifies the set with this identifier and parses with the respective parsing conditions.

identifierSource.description:
Source for considering the unique value.
Supported Values: EMAIL_SUBJECT, EMAIL_CONTENT, DEFAULT_VALUE.

defaultValue.description: Default Value is considered if any of the properties do not match with the respective configured values.

condition.title: emailCondition
condition.description: Conditions to filter the values from the email data

contentSource.description: Source from which the values should be considered.

operator.description: Unique keys required to filter the values from the content source.

endValue.description:
End value.
Start value and End value are filter properties. These properties are used to filter a certain value between the start value and end value.

regexStr.description:
Regex string.
Provide a regex string of the value that considered from the content source.

propertyMappings.description: Map third-party attributes with OpsRamp attributes

ticketType.description: OpsRamp supports the following ticket types:

containerEngineType.description: Specifies the k8s deployment environment where k8s cluster is on-premise or deployed using a cloud provider. Supported values : cloud | onPrem

configFiles.description: Specifies container runtime engine. Values: Docker | ContainerD

parameters.name: tenantId
parameters.description: Describes the client ID or msp ID of the tenant
